books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Clifford D. Simak
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Clifford D. Simak, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: The Man in the Brown Suit
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: Anne Beddingfeld travels to South Africa after finding a cryptic note beside the body of a man whose death she witnessed in the London Underground.

books.title: The Autobiography of an Idea
books.author: Louis H. Sullivan
books.summary: Famed architect Louis H. Sullivan recounts his life and career.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: The Prince and the Pauper
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: The Prince of England and a pauper find their identities switched.

books.title: Three Men in a Boat
books.author: Jerome K. Jerome
books.summary: The humorous travelogue of a boating holiday down the Thames taken by three friends and their dog.

books.title: The Duchess of Malfi
books.author: John Webster
books.summary: A widow marries beneath her station and against her brothers’ orders and, enraged, they take their revenge.

books.title: Vathek
books.author: William Beckford
books.summary: A powerful caliph embarks on a quest to harness the powers of darkness.

books.title: The Thirty-Nine Steps
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: An expatriate returning to England after many years in South Africa is accused of a murder he did not commit, and has to flee from the police and other more dangerous pursuers.

books.title: The King in Yellow
books.author: Robert W. Chambers
books.summary: Ten short stories of madness, hauntings, romance, and art.

books.title: Twelve Years a Slave
books.author: Solomon Northup
books.summary: The account of a free black man kidnapped in 1841 and sold into slavery, from which it took twelve years to free himself.

books.title: The Dain Curse
books.author: Dashiell Hammett
books.summary: A detective assigned to investigate a diamond theft finds himself entangled by a family curse.

books.title: Human Nature and Conduct
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: Dewey applies the theory of pragmatism to morality, reason, and society.

books.title: The Genealogy of Morals
books.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
books.summary: Three essays analyzing the origins, meaning, and value of the concepts of good, evil, and bad; of guilt, punishment, and bad conscience; and of ascetic ideals, including those of truth and truthfulness.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Mina Loy
books.summary: A collection of poems by Mina Loy.

books.title: The Little Nugget
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: The ambitious fiancée of an English gentleman asks him to kidnap the son of an American businessman from boarding school, before professional kidnappers get to him first.

books.title: The Moon Pool
books.author: A. Merritt
books.summary: A group of adventurers search for their friends, who were lost while exploring the otherworldly secrets of a monument discovered on a chain of island ruins.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: A collection of nine short fiction works by influential supernatural and horror author Arthur Machen.

books.title: Festus
books.author: Philip James Bailey
books.summary: A man goes on a quest for knowledge, truth, and understanding in the face of the complexities of existence and spirituality.

books.title: Travel Essays
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A collection of Robert Louis Stevenson’s travel essays.
